docs.snippet: EU lawmakers will investigate whether the data of more than 50 million Facebook users has been misused, the head of European Parliament said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: EU Lawmakers to Investigate Alleged Misuse of Facebook Users' Data
headline.main: EU Lawmakers to Investigate Alleged Misuse of Facebook Users' Data

docs.snippet: Internet company Mozilla Corp said on Wednesday it was suspending advertising on Facebook Inc's social media platform on concerns of data privacy.

headline.print_headline: Mozilla Suspends Ads on Facebook on Data Privacy Concerns
headline.main: Mozilla Suspends Ads on Facebook on Data Privacy Concerns

docs.snippet: Germany's justice minister said on Thursday she had asked to speak to Facebook executives to find out whether the social media site's 30 million users in the country were affected by a scandal involving the handling of personal data.

headline.print_headline: German Justice Minister Calls in Facebook Over Data Scandal
headline.main: German Justice Minister Calls in Facebook Over Data Scandal

docs.snippet: Noah said Facebook needed “to be held accountable” for a data leak that compromised millions of users’ personal information.

headline.print_headline: Trevor Noah Attacks Facebook and Urges Users to ‘Be Vigilant’
headline.main: Trevor Noah Attacks Facebook and Urges Users to ‘Be Vigilant’

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday that the social media company made mistakes that allowed data about users to end up with the analytics firm Cambridge Analytica and said the company would make changes.

headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg Says Facebook 'Made Mistakes' on Cambridge Analytica
headline.main: Zuckerberg Says Facebook 'Made Mistakes' on Cambridge Analytica

docs.snippet: German Justice Minister Katarina Barley has asked to speak to Facebook executives to find out whether the social media site's 30 million users in the country were affected by what she described as "scandal" involving personal data.

headline.print_headline: German Justice Minister Calls in Facebook Over Data 'Scandal'
headline.main: German Justice Minister Calls in Facebook Over Data 'Scandal'

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc will be removed from the Australia-based BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders Exchange Traded Fund (ETHI) due to recent "controversies", its Responsible Investment Committee (RIC) said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Dropped From Australian Ethical ETF After Data Breach
headline.main: Facebook Dropped From Australian Ethical ETF After Data Breach

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc faced new calls for regulation from within U.S. Congress and was hit with questions about personal data safeguards on Saturday after reports a political consultant gained inappropriate access to 50 million users' data starting in 2014...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Critics Want Regulation, Investigation After Data Misuse
headline.main: Facebook Critics Want Regulation, Investigation After Data Misuse

docs.snippet: A Cambridge University academic who harvested data on millions of Facebook users said he had been made a scapegoat by the social network and a UK-based political consultancy, and that the accuracy of the dataset had been exaggerated.

headline.print_headline: Academic Behind Facebook Breach Says He Is a 'Scapegoat': BBC
headline.main: Academic Behind Facebook Breach Says He Is a 'Scapegoat': BBC

docs.snippet: U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein, the top Democrat on the Judiciary Committee, said on Tuesday that Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg should testify in Congress about his company's treatment of users' data.

headline.print_headline: Senate Democrat Wants Facebook CEO Zuckerberg to Testify
headline.main: Senate Democrat Wants Facebook CEO Zuckerberg to Testify
